title: rustdoc: confusing sidebar for items with multiple impls (like `Any`)

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body: The sidebar for `Any` has three definitions of each of its methods: If you click through to, say, each of the definitions of `downcast_mut`, it's not clear what the distinction between them is: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/220205/118901445-2776d000-b8c8-11eb-9b58-7e3d94af3502.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/220205/118901467-3493bf00-b8c8-11eb-8ea7-aa679919aa80.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/220205/118901484-3d849080-b8c8-11eb-9d30-25f13c1d2389.png) --- If you collapse all the methods, it's becomes a bit clearer: `Any` has three different implementation blocks: ``` impl dyn Any + 'static impl dyn Any + 'static + Send impl dyn Any + 'static + Send + Sync ``` One thing that could help a little would be to tweak the sidebar sorting so methods from different impls are grouped together. Perhaps even better would be to put horizontal bars between impls in the sidebar. It would also be nice to have more context when you jump directly to one method of a struct that has multiple impls. The context should ideally indicate "this is for impl X; there are N impls for this struct," but I'm not sure exactly how it should look.
